series_description: This series documents the receipt of abstract records and data convictions from Virginia courts and reciprocal states for traffic offenses of a less serious nature (i.e.: first offense of a safety belt violation, failure to obey highway lane markings, failure to stop for an emergency vehicle, etc.). These documents are used to enforce public highway safety and driver monitoring. This series may include, but is not limited to, original and amended court information
legal_citation: COV Section 46.2-383; Section 46.2-492; Code 49 C.F.R. Section 384.231 (D)

series_description: This series documents the receipt of abstract records and data convictions from Virginia courts and reciprocal states for relatively serious traffic offenses (i.e.: various speeding violations, etc.). These documents are used to enforce public highway safety and driver monitoring. This series may include, but is not limited to, original and amended court information
legal_citation: COV Section 46.2-383; Section 46.2-492; Code 49 C.F.R. Section 384.231 (D)

series_description: This series documents the receipt of abstract records and data convictions from Virginia courts and reciprocal states for serious traffic offenses (i.e.: Driving Under the Influence (DUI), reckless driving, driving on a suspended license, etc.). series_description: This series documents the licensure of private driver training schools, driver improvement clinics, and third- party testers by the Driver Training Work Center(DTWC). This series may include, but is not limited to:surety bonds, Certificates of Insurance, school and instructor licensing applications, audit reports, and correspondence. 46.2-1700 et. seq.

This series contains copies of alternative documentation submitted by applicants for a driver's license or photo identification card who are unable to provide documents from the acceptable list of documents approved by the Department. Applicants for a driver's license or identification card are required to provide documents from this list for proof of identity, residency, and social security number prior to the issuance of these credentials by the agency. These copies of alternative documentation include documents from entities such as the US State Department, US Citizenship and Immigration Services, Vital Records, the Social Security Administration, banks, and utility companies. The copies are forwarded from a DMV Customer Service Center or sent directly from a customer to DMV Headquarters, where a review of the documentation is conducted by the Identification Review Services Unit to determine if the license or identification card can be issued to the applicant
retention_statement: 7 Years after end of calendar year
legal_citation: Code of Virginia Sections 46.2-323 et. seq.

series_description: Documents the Department's review of medical files of drivers reported to be incompetent to operate a motor vehicle as required by
legal_citation: Code of Virginia, Section 46.2-322. Medical files are submitted by customers or physicians. Files are for customers who require continuing review. COV 46.2-322

series_description: Documents the customer's death and ends the Department's review of medical files required by
legal_citation: Code of Virginia Section 46.2-322. Files are for customers that the Department has been informed are deceased.Additional Disposition Information: Upon notification of death, remove from "Active Customer" files, 100401, retain for 1 year, then destroy. COV 46.2-322

series_description: Documents the end of Department's review of medical files of drivers reported to be incompetent to operate a motor vehicle as required by
legal_citation: Code of Virginia, Section 46.2-322. Files are for customers who no longer require continuing review.Additional Disposition Information: Upon end of review, remove from "Active Customer" files, 100401, retain for 1 year, then destroy. COV 46.2-322
